title: 108_hr2061
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Youth Anti-Drug Media Campaign Reauthorization Act of 2003" and includes general improvements to the National Anti-Drug Media Campaign. The Drug-Free Media Campaign Act of 1998 is amended to the National Youth Anti-Drug Media Campaign Act, focusing on preventing drug abuse among young people, increasing awareness of adults, and encouraging discussions about the dangers of drug use. The National Youth Anti-Drug Media Campaign Act of 1998 is amended to focus on preventing drug abuse among young people. The Director, in consultation with the Partnership for a Drug Free America, determines the overall purposes and strategy of the national media campaign, with responsibilities outlined for implementing the campaign. The Director partners with the Partnership for a Drug-Free America to recommend strategies and create advertising for the national media campaign, focusing on addressing drug threats at national, regional, and local levels. The Director collaborates with the Partnership for a Drug-Free America to develop advertising strategies for the national media campaign, including testing all ads before use and hiring a media buying contractor for ad placement. The Director ensures sufficient funds are allocated for the national media campaign, with an exception that no funds shall be used for advertising. The Director ensures funds are allocated for the national media campaign, with an exception that no funds shall be used for creative development of advertisements, except in specific circumstances. The Director allocates funds for the national media campaign, with a requirement for a no-cost match of equivalent value of advertising time or space prior to executing a contract. The Director ensures responsible use of federal funds for the national media campaign, with specific requirements for advertising material and sponsorship identification. At least 85% of funds are allocated for advertising time and space, with a cap of $5,000,000 for material development each fiscal year. The Director ensures responsible use of federal funds for the national media campaign, with a cap of $5,000,000 for material development each fiscal year. SEC. 104. FINANCIAL AND PERFORMANCE ACCOUNTABILITY. The Director is required to conduct audits and evaluations of the national media campaign's effectiveness based on various studies and submit a report to Congress. The Director conducts audits and evaluations of the national media campaign's effectiveness based on industry standards, submitting a report to Congress as required. The Director submits an annual report to Congress detailing the national media campaign's strategy, accomplishments, efficiency, advertising plans, fund usage policies, and contracts. Additionally, $195,000,000 is authorized for the Office of National Drug Control Policy for fiscal years 2004 through 2008.
